div.p:
I return the drawings.
If the artist could put
rings on the legs
of Shinte up to
the knees & on
the arms it would
be an improvement
as I mention the
gait of the Balonda
gentlemen as regulated
by the weight
either real or
supposed of these
ornaments.

I send an imaginary
section of
the the Fizzurefissure of
the Falls in order
to explain the
wearing away
side-ways of the
rock in which
it occurs. Can
a wood cut in
the page be made
of it?

Also a rude pen & ink sketch of the
Marimba or
musical instruments
of the North from
my description.
If the keys laid
across the calabashes
were larger it
would convey
a good idea
but I don't care
much about
it -

I have thought it
better to detain it for
a lady friend who
draws well - but
is now in childbed.
Iif she makes a
good thing of it I shall
forward it. Will you
oblige me with a copy of the Falls to shew
my friends here. I shall take care no
one will copy or see it who
will make a bad use of it.

Mrs Grimstone wishes the drawing of
Lake Ngami at your convenience.
47 Grt Marlborough St
Regent St
